intro: Lapeirousia plicata subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the Orange River daffodil, is a bulbous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is typically found in the Western and Northern Cape provinces, growing in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to bloom successfully.
